articles.headline: Canada Saw Plot to Seize Officials
articles.snippet: The plot involved a series of violent attacks and the beheading of Canada's prime minister, prosecutors said.
articles.abstract: The plot involved a series of violent attacks and the beheading of Canada's prime minister, prosecutors said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRAMPTON, Ontario, June 6 — Prosecutors here assert that some of the men charged in a terror plot last week planned a series of violent attacks that included seizing Parliament and beheading Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other lawmakers if Canadian troops were not withdrawn from Afghanistan, a defense lawyer said in court Tuesday.

articles.headline: Iraq to Release Detainees in Bid to Ease Tensions
articles.snippet: The U.S. military said the decision to free the detainees had been agreed to in a joint review by Iraqi and American officials.
articles.abstract: The U.S. military said the decision to free the detainees had been agreed to in a joint review by Iraqi and American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Iraq, June 6 — Iraq's new government said Tuesday that it would release 2,500 detainees, nearly 10 percent of those held in Iraqi and American detention centers, and that it would adopt a "national reconciliation" plan to reintegrate former members of Saddam Hussein's ruling Baath Party into society.

articles.headline: The Hard Sell in Frankfurt
articles.snippet: With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.
articles.abstract: With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, June 6 — With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.

articles.headline: The Once-Humble Hobby of Scrapbooking Has Moved On.
articles.snippet: Offering Barbie-pink hardware for scrapbookers has not worked, but finding ways for women to preserve their families' memories sets the cash register ringing.
articles.abstract: Offering Barbie-pink hardware for scrapbookers has not worked, but finding ways for women to preserve their families' memories sets the cash register ringing.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEVOTEES of the hobby known as scrapbooking spent an estimated $3 billion last year on patterned paper, ribbons, stamps, brads and fabrics. They also spent untold hours combining these things with family photographs to make personal albums.

articles.headline: Shacks in South Africa Can Garner Fancy Prices
articles.snippet: South Africa's real estate boom is spreading to townships, the slums erected during apartheid for black citizens.
articles.abstract: South Africa's real estate boom is spreading to townships, the slums erected during apartheid for black citizens.
articles.lead_paragraph: Looking for URBAN AMBIENCE (tarpaper shantytown just down the road)? Check out 21 Jonkerhoek St., a two-story HANDYMAN'S SPECIAL (cracked, boarded-over windows) with LOW-MAINT YARD (painted concrete). And it's IMMED AVAIL (if left vacant, squatters will take over).

articles.headline: Pick Your One Special Power
articles.snippet: If every camera is essentially alike, what's left to attract buyers? The answer: specialization. Adapt or die.
articles.abstract: If every camera is essentially alike, what's left to attract buyers? The answer: specialization. Adapt or die.
articles.lead_paragraph: EVERY modern digital camera offers roughly the same features: zoom lens, movie mode, output jack for displaying photos on a TV, rapid-fire burst mode and so on.

articles.headline: In Switch, G.M. Shareholders Ask Board for Stronger Say in Elections
articles.snippet: For G.M. the votes were another reflection of the company's diminished fortunes and dissatisfaction among many investors.
articles.abstract: For G.M. the votes were another reflection of the company's diminished fortunes and dissatisfaction among many investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del., June 6 — Shareholders of the troubled General Motors approved two proposals on Tuesday aimed at giving them more influence over the way directors are elected, the first time they have defied G.M.'s recommendations.

articles.headline: Goodbye, Glue. Hello, Digital. The Once-Humble Hobby of Scrapbooking Has Moved On.
articles.snippet: Some scrapbooking enthusiasts are using computers to create layouts that would have taken many hours of painstaking cutting and pasting; women, who comprise bulk of scrapbookers, are not traditionally those who make major computer purchases, so co...
articles.abstract: Some scrapbooking enthusiasts are using computers to create layouts that would have taken many hours of painstaking cutting and pasting; women, who comprise bulk of scrapbookers, are not traditionally those who make major computer purchases, so companies like Adobe and Hewlett-Packard are taking notice and marketing products specifically to them; several Web sites have been created to support digital scrapbooking; photos (M)
articles.lead_paragraph: DEVOTEES of the hobby known as scrapbooking spent an estimated $3 billion last year on patterned paper, ribbons, stamps, brads and fabrics. They also spent untold hours combining these things with family photographs to make personal albums.

articles.headline: Estate Tax Showdown Is Splitting The G.O.P.
articles.snippet: Senate Republicans, pushing once again to abolish the estate tax on inherited wealth, are split about whether to push for a full repeal that would probably fail, or seek a more cautious compromise with Democrats that could pass.     Permanently re...
articles.abstract: Senate Republicans, pushing once again to abolish the estate tax on inherited wealth, are split about whether to push for a full repeal that would probably fail, or seek a more cautious compromise with Democrats that could pass.     Permanently repealing the estate tax, or what Republicans have branded the ''death tax,'' is a priority for President Bush and many Republican lawmakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 6 - Senate Republicans, pushing once again to abolish the estate tax on inherited wealth, are split about whether to push for a full repeal that would probably fail, or seek a more cautious compromise with Democrats that could pass.

articles.headline: Pick Your One Special Power
articles.snippet: Roundup of digital cameras, each with special features to help differentiate it from increasing number on market; photo (M)
articles.abstract: Roundup of digital cameras, each with special features to help differentiate it from increasing number on market; photo (M)
articles.lead_paragraph: EVERY modern digital camera offers roughly the same features: zoom lens, movie mode, output jack for displaying photos on a TV, rapid-fire burst mode and so on.

articles.headline: What Netflix Could Teach Hollywood
articles.snippet: BETWEEN ''The Godfather'' and ''The Godfather: Part II,'' Francis Ford Coppola made a movie called ''The Conversation.'' It stars Gene Hackman as a paranoid wiretapper in Watergate-era San Francisco, and the cast includes Robert Duvall, a young Ha...
articles.abstract: BETWEEN ''The Godfather'' and ''The Godfather: Part II,'' Francis Ford Coppola made a movie called ''The Conversation.'' It stars Gene Hackman as a paranoid wiretapper in Watergate-era San Francisco, and the cast includes Robert Duvall, a young Harrison Ford, the woman who played Shirley in ''Laverne & Shirley'' and the guy who played Fredo Corleone in ''The Godfather.''      The movie was nominated for best picture in 1975, and Mr. Coppola has actually called it the finest film he has ever made. After watching it this week, I wouldn't go that far, but it is certainly better than nearly anything at the multiplex right now.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS GATOS, Calif. - BETWEEN "The Godfather" and "The Godfather: Part II," Francis Ford Coppola made a movie called "The Conversation." It stars Gene Hackman as a paranoid wiretapper in Watergate-era San Francisco, and the cast includes Robert Duvall, a young Harrison Ford, the woman who played Shirley in "Laverne & Shirley" and the guy who played Fredo Corleone in "The Godfather."

articles.headline: In Switch, G.M. Shareholders Ask Board for Stronger Say in Elections
articles.snippet: Shareholders of the troubled General Motors approved two proposals on Tuesday aimed at giving them more influence over the way directors are elected, the first time they have defied G.M.'s recommendations.     For G.M., which faces an array of com...
articles.abstract: Shareholders of the troubled General Motors approved two proposals on Tuesday aimed at giving them more influence over the way directors are elected, the first time they have defied G.M.'s recommendations.     For G.M., which faces an array of competitive and cost issues, the votes, which were nonbinding, were another reflection of the company's diminished fortunes and the dissatisfaction among many investors with its leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del., June 6 - Shareholders of the troubled General Motors approved two proposals on Tuesday aimed at giving them more influence over the way directors are elected, the first time they have defied G.M.'s recommendations.

articles.headline: Canada Saw Plot to Seize Officials
articles.snippet: Prosecutors here assert that some of the men charged in a terror plot last week planned a series of violent attacks that included seizing Parliament and beheading Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other lawmakers if Canadian troops were not withdr...
articles.abstract: Prosecutors here assert that some of the men charged in a terror plot last week planned a series of violent attacks that included seizing Parliament and beheading Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other lawmakers if Canadian troops were not withdrawn from Afghanistan, a defense lawyer said in court Tuesday.     The accusations were part of a government summary that was given to a lawyer for one of the suspects and other defense lawyers just before preliminary hearings began. The document was not made public, but the lawyer disclosed part of its content because he said he wanted to force the government to disclose its evidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRAMPTON, Ontario, June 6 - Prosecutors here assert that some of the men charged in a terror plot last week planned a series of violent attacks that included seizing Parliament and beheading Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other lawmakers if Canadian troops were not withdrawn from Afghanistan, a defense lawyer said in court Tuesday.

articles.headline: Senate Contender in Florida Presses On
articles.snippet: Undaunted by a run of horrific poll numbers, staff turmoil and public doubts from leaders of her party, Representative Katherine Harris is thinking confidently beyond November.      Once Ms. Harris wins her race for a Senate seat, she says, she pl...
articles.abstract: Undaunted by a run of horrific poll numbers, staff turmoil and public doubts from leaders of her party, Representative Katherine Harris is thinking confidently beyond November.      Once Ms. Harris wins her race for a Senate seat, she says, she plans to travel everywhere with a guide dog.
articles.lead_paragraph: VENICE, Fla. - Undaunted by a run of horrific poll numbers, staff turmoil and public doubts from leaders of her party, Representative Katherine Harris is thinking confidently beyond November.

articles.headline: The Hard Sell in Frankfurt
articles.snippet: With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.     Transforming itself into a giant billboard, Frankfurt lighted up its skyline over the weekend with vast, projected images of socc...
articles.abstract: With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.     Transforming itself into a giant billboard, Frankfurt lighted up its skyline over the weekend with vast, projected images of soccer stars and great moments from past tournaments, including gauzy shots of the gold World Cup trophy.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, June 6 - With the kickoff of the World Cup just days away, even this most buttoned-down of German cities is cutting loose.

articles.headline: Iraq to Release Detainees in Bid to Ease Tensions
articles.snippet: Iraq's new government said Tuesday that it would release 2,500 detainees, nearly 10 percent of those held in Iraqi and American detention centers, and that it would adopt a ''national reconciliation'' plan to reintegrate former members of Saddam H...
articles.abstract: Iraq's new government said Tuesday that it would release 2,500 detainees, nearly 10 percent of those held in Iraqi and American detention centers, and that it would adopt a ''national reconciliation'' plan to reintegrate former members of Saddam Hussein's ruling Baath Party into society.     Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki said the first 500 detainees would be released Wednesday, with others following in the next few days. An American military spokesman said the decision to free the detainees, the largest group to be released in the 38 months since the American-led invasion, had been agreed to in a joint review by Iraqi and American officials. He said those freed would not include any deemed ''guilty of serious crimes such as bombings, torture, kidnapping and murder.''
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Iraq, June 6 - Iraq's new government said Tuesday that it would release 2,500 detainees, nearly 10 percent of those held in Iraqi and American detention centers, and that it would adopt a "national reconciliation" plan to reintegrate former members of Saddam Hussein's ruling Baath Party into society.

articles.headline: Papers Show Guidant Considered Warning Doctors of Hazards
articles.snippet: Last year, as executives of the Guidant Corporation defended their decision not to tell doctors about significant heart device defects, they cited concerns that doing so could have exposed patients to risks from unnecessary device replacement.    ...
articles.abstract: Last year, as executives of the Guidant Corporation defended their decision not to tell doctors about significant heart device defects, they cited concerns that doing so could have exposed patients to risks from unnecessary device replacement.     But newly released company records show that Guidant drafted a detailed document last year that disclosed such hazards to physicians. In that proposed ''Dear Doctor'' letter, dated January 2005, Guidant stated that two company models had an electrical flaw. It also told physicians that it had pulled back all units not yet implanted into patients.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last year, as executives of the Guidant Corporation defended their decision not to tell doctors about significant heart device defects, they cited concerns that doing so could have exposed patients to risks from unnecessary device replacement.

articles.headline: Senate Emphasis on Ideology Has Some in G.O.P. Anxious
articles.snippet: Though some Republican candidates may relish the Senate's current concentration on same-sex marriage and other ideologically charged topics, Senator Lincoln Chafee of Rhode Island is not among them.     ''It may stir up my primary voters a little ...
articles.abstract: Though some Republican candidates may relish the Senate's current concentration on same-sex marriage and other ideologically charged topics, Senator Lincoln Chafee of Rhode Island is not among them.     ''It may stir up my primary voters a little bit against me,'' said Mr. Chafee, a centrist Republican up for re-election. He opposes the push for a constitutional amendment to prohibit same-sex marriage and is under intense pressure to back a proposed amendment that would forbid flag burning. ''I'm collateral damage.''
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 6 - Though some Republican candidates may relish the Senate's current concentration on same-sex marriage and other ideologically charged topics, Senator Lincoln Chafee of Rhode Island is not among them.

articles.headline: Shacks in South Africa Can Garner Fancy Prices
articles.snippet: Looking for URBAN AMBIENCE (tarpaper shantytown just down the road)? Check out 21 Jonkerhoek St., a two-story HANDYMAN'S SPECIAL (cracked, boarded-over windows) with LOW-MAINT YARD (painted concrete). And it's IMMED AVAIL (if left vacant, squatter...
articles.abstract: Looking for URBAN AMBIENCE (tarpaper shantytown just down the road)? Check out 21 Jonkerhoek St., a two-story HANDYMAN'S SPECIAL (cracked, boarded-over windows) with LOW-MAINT YARD (painted concrete). And it's IMMED AVAIL (if left vacant, squatters will take over).         Whoops: too late. 21 Jonkerhoek was just snapped up for 140,000 rand, or about $21,000. ''Ten or 15 people were interested in buying it,'' said Glenn Renquest, the agent. ''Even when the deal was done, people still called in.''
articles.lead_paragraph: MITCHELL'S PLAIN, South Africa, June 2 - Looking for URBAN AMBIENCE (tarpaper shantytown just down the road)? Check out 21 Jonkerhoek St., a two-story HANDYMAN'S SPECIAL (cracked, boarded-over windows) with LOW-MAINT YARD (painted concrete). And it's IMMED AVAIL (if left vacant, squatters will take over).
